page.title: 06Midsummer Hill Hill Fort
page.content: This is one of three{pre-historic hill {forts}on the Malvern Hills, the others being at the Worcestershire and the Herefordshire Beacons. The Iron-age camp on Midsummer hill was excavated between 1966 and 1970 by Birmingham University. The excavations showed that the camp was probably built in the 2nd century B.C. and occupied for a long time. A mile of double-ditched stone-capped ramparts enclosed about 30 acres with a large single-walled stock enclosure outside. Evidence of square huts and timber framed buildings were found and, at times, the population may have been 800. There is spring water within the main camp. Unlike most of the Malvern Hills this area is now wooded.
